items.title: Ex-FBI boss James Comey indicted as Trump clamps down on political rivals
items.standfirst: Former FBI chief James Comey, a vocal critic of Donald Trump, was indicted Thursday (September 25) on two criminal counts as the US president pressed a legal offensive against political rivals. The move followed Trump’s public call for Attorney General Pam Bondi to act against Comey and other perceived enemies.
items.content: Former FBI chief James Comey, a vocal critic of Donald Trump, was indicted Thursday (September 25) on two criminal counts as the US president pressed a legal offensive against political rivals. The move followed Trump’s public call for Attorney General Pam Bondi to act against Comey and other perceived enemies.

items.content: President Trump's Justice Department charged former FBI Director James Comey with lying to Congress — revisiting controversies over the FBI's Trump-Russia probe from nearly a decade ago.

items.title: Former FBI Director James Comey responds to his indictment: "I'm not afraid"
items.standfirst: Former FBI Director James Comey has been indicted. He is charged with one count of making false statements and another count of obstruction of justice. Comey himself posted a video to Instagram sharing his response to the news. Scott Fredericksen, defense attorney and former federal prosecutor, joins CBS News with more.

items.title: Ex-FBI chief charged with lying to Congress after investigating Trump
items.standfirst: Ex-FBI director James Comey has been charged with obstruction of justice and making a false statement to Congress.
items.content: Ex-FBI director James Comey has been charged with obstruction of justice and making a false statement to Congress.

ai_summary: James Comey was indicted on two felony counts of lying to Congress and obstruction.
The indictment followed pressure from Donald Trump to investigate Comey.
Trump hailed the indictment as "justice in America" and a win against corruption.
Comey maintains his innocence, claiming the charges are politically motivated.
The indictment marks the first charges against a Trump political rival.

clusters.title: TikTok Gets $14 Billion Proposed Price Tag in Trump Deal
clusters.neutral_headline: TikTok Deal Includes $14 Billion Price Tag

items.title: TikTok Gets $14 Billion Proposed Price Tag in Trump Deal
items.standfirst: The $14 billion price tag for TikTok’s US business cited by Vice President JD Vance on Thursday is well below previous projections that scaled closer to $40 billion. The estimate comes as President Donald Trump pushes forward a plan for American investors to buy the US operation from Chinese internet firm ByteDance Ltd. Tyler Kendall reports on Bloomberg Television.
items.content: The $14 billion price tag for TikTok’s US business cited by Vice President JD Vance on Thursday is well below previous projections that scaled closer to $40 billion. The estimate comes as President Donald Trump pushes forward a plan for American investors to buy the US operation from Chinese internet firm ByteDance Ltd. Tyler Kendall reports on Bloomberg Television.

items.title: Ex-FBI director James Comey indicted on two charges with reports that he will surrender on Friday - US politics live
items.standfirst: Comey is expected to surrender and have his initial appearance in federal district court todayDonald Trump signed an executive order on Thursday outlining the terms of a deal to transfer TikTok to a US owner.Trump said he and China’s president Xi Jinping had come to an agreement to allow TikTok to continue operating in the US, separating the social media platform from its Chinese owner ByteDance. Trump said the deal complies with a law that would have forced the shutdown of the app for American users had it not been divested and sold to a US owner. Continue reading...

Trump said the deal complies with a law that would have forced the shutdown of the app for American users had it not been divested and sold to a US owner. Continue reading...

items.title: Trump signs executive order to hand TikTok over to his US allies
items.standfirst: US President Donald Trump signed an executive order on Thursday laying out his plan to sell Chinese-owned TikTok to US and other global investors, most of whom are his allies.
items.content: US President Donald Trump signed an executive order on Thursday laying out his plan to sell Chinese-owned TikTok to US and other global investors, most of whom are his allies.

items.title: Abu Dhabi royal family to take stake in TikTok US under Trump deal
items.standfirst: MGX, chaired by Sheikh Tahnoon bin Zayed Al Nahyan, will take 15% stake, with social media firm valued at $14bnTrump signs executive order to transfer TikTok to US ownersThe Abu Dhabi royal family is to take a stake in TikTok’s US business after Donald Trump signed an executive order brokering a deal valuing the social media company at $14bn (£10.5bn).MGX, a fund chaired by Sheikh Tahnoon bin Zayed Al Nahyan, will take a 15% stake and gain a board seat when TikTok US is spun out. Continue reading...
items.content: MGX, chaired by Sheikh Tahnoon bin Zayed Al Nahyan, will take 15% stake, with social media firm valued at $14bnTrump signs executive order to transfer TikTok to US ownersThe Abu Dhabi royal family is to take a stake in TikTok’s US business after Donald Trump signed an executive order brokering a deal valuing the social media company at $14bn (£10.5bn).MGX, a fund chaired by Sheikh Tahnoon bin Zayed Al Nahyan, will take a 15% stake and gain a board seat when TikTok US is spun out. Continue reading...

items.title: TikTok’s $14 Billion Price Tag in Trump Deal Stuns Investors
items.standfirst: The $14 billion price tag proposed for TikTok’s US business values it more like a traditional energy or food company than a global social media powerhouse, and may present a bargain for potential buyers including Larry Ellison’s Oracle Corp. and partner Silver Lake Management LLC.
items.content: The $14 billion price tag proposed for TikTok’s US business values it more like a traditional energy or food company than a global social media powerhouse, and may present a bargain for potential buyers including Larry Ellison’s Oracle Corp. and partner Silver Lake Management LLC.

items.title: Murdoch, Ellison and China: what we know about the US’s TikTok deal
items.standfirst: TikTok’s future in the US has been in limbo for over year, but Trump says Washington and Beijing finally have a dealThe White House has confirmed a deal to transfer ownership of TikTok to a group of US investors.Donald Trump signed an executive order on Thursday that creates a structure for the investors to take over operations of the Chinese social media company in the US. Continue reading...
items.content: TikTok’s future in the US has been in limbo for over year, but Trump says Washington and Beijing finally have a dealThe White House has confirmed a deal to transfer ownership of TikTok to a group of US investors.Donald Trump signed an executive order on Thursday that creates a structure for the investors to take over operations of the Chinese social media company in the US. Continue reading...

items.title: Trump signs executive order to transfer TikTok to US owners
items.standfirst: Agreement separates app from Chinese owner ByteDance and allows US investors to take 80% stakeDonald Trump signed an executive order on Thursday outlining the terms of a deal to transfer TikTok to a US owner.Trump said he and China’s president Xi Jinping had come to an agreement to allow TikTok to continue operating in the US, separating the social media platform from its Chinese owner ByteDance. Trump said the deal complies with a law that would have forced the shutdown of the app for American users had it not been divested and sold to a US owner. Continue reading...
items.content: Agreement separates app from Chinese owner ByteDance and allows US investors to take 80% stakeDonald Trump signed an executive order on Thursday outlining the terms of a deal to transfer TikTok to a US owner.Trump said he and China’s president Xi Jinping had come to an agreement to allow TikTok to continue operating in the US, separating the social media platform from its Chinese owner ByteDance. Trump said the deal complies with a law that would have forced the shutdown of the app for American users had it not been divested and sold to a US owner. Continue reading...

items.title: Trump Executive Order Will Hand TikTok Over to US Investors
items.standfirst: After five deadline extensions and several rounds of negotiations, President Trump signed an executive order to put TikTok’s US operations in the hands of Oracle and other American investors.
items.content: After five deadline extensions and several rounds of negotiations, President Trump signed an executive order to put TikTok’s US operations in the hands of Oracle and other American investors.

items.title: Trump Signs TikTok Order With US App Valued at $14 Billion
items.standfirst: President Donald Trump advanced plans for American investors to buy TikTok’s US operations from its Chinese owner ByteDance Ltd., with officials setting a potential value of $14 billion and outlining measures to ensure security of the new venture.
items.content: President Donald Trump advanced plans for American investors to buy TikTok’s US operations from its Chinese owner ByteDance Ltd., with officials setting a potential value of $14 billion and outlining measures to ensure security of the new venture.

items.title: Murdoch’s TikTok? Trump offers allies another lever of media control
items.standfirst: Under the known terms of the deal with China, TikTok would get a new board, including Murdochs and EllisonsDonald Trump revealed last week the US and China are close to inking a deal to let TikTok continue operating in the US. Details are not final, but should the agreement go through as has been reported, the owners of the US’s most powerful cable TV channels may soon also steer the nation’s most influential social network. The arrangement would gift Trump’s billionaire allies a degree of control over US media that would be vast and unprecedented.Here’s what we know. Under the known terms of the deal, which Trump declared has the tentative buy-in of Chinese president Xi Jinping, TikTok in the US would get a new group of US investors, led by the US software giant Oracle, which would license TikTok’s vaunted recommendation algorithm and take over its security. Continue reading...
items.content: Under the known terms of the deal with China, TikTok would get a new board, including Murdochs and EllisonsDonald Trump revealed last week the US and China are close to inking a deal to let TikTok continue operating in the US. Details are not final, but should the agreement go through as has been reported, the owners of the US’s most powerful cable TV channels may soon also steer the nation’s most influential social network. The arrangement would gift Trump’s billionaire allies a degree of control over US media that would be vast and unprecedented.Here’s what we know. Under the known terms of the deal, which Trump declared has the tentative buy-in of Chinese president Xi Jinping, TikTok in the US would get a new group of US investors, led by the US software giant Oracle, which would license TikTok’s vaunted recommendation algorithm and take over its security. Continue reading...

ai_summary: The proposed price tag for TikTok's US business is approximately $14 billion.
This valuation is significantly lower than previous projections, which were closer to $40 billion.
President Trump signed an executive order outlining the transfer of TikTok to a US owner.
The deal involves a consortium including Oracle and a private equity firm.
The deal aims to comply with a law that would have forced the app's shutdown.

items.title: Trump announces ‘national security’ tariffs on drugs, trucks, furniture
Daimler Truck, Traton shares fall as Trump announces truck tariffs
Trump announces 100% tariff on branded pharmaceutical products
items.standfirst: Drugmakers’ shares fall modestly after US president’s move spares majority of generic imports
items.content: Drugmakers’ shares fall modestly after US president’s move spares majority of generic imports

items.title: Trump announces ‘national security’ tariffs on drugs, trucks, furniture
items.standfirst: The 100% tariff on pharmaceuticals, 25% on trucks, and 30% on furniture will come into effect on October 1.
items.content: The 100% tariff on pharmaceuticals, 25% on trucks, and 30% on furniture will come into effect on October 1.

items.title: Trump to place import taxes on drugs, home furnishings and heavy trucks
items.standfirst: President Trump said he will put import taxes of 100% on pharmaceutical drugs, 50% on kitchen cabinets and bathroom vanities, 30% on upholstered furniture and 25% on heavy trucks starting on Oct. 1.
items.content: President Trump said he will put import taxes of 100% on pharmaceutical drugs, 50% on kitchen cabinets and bathroom vanities, 30% on upholstered furniture and 25% on heavy trucks starting on Oct. 1.(Image credit: Michael Probst)

items.title: Trump slaps 100 percent tariffs on drugs, trucks and 'kitchen cabinets'
items.standfirst: US President Donald Trump on Thursday announced steep tariffs on pharmaceuticals, heavy trucks, home fixtures and furniture, escalating his global trade war. The measures, effective October 1, mark Trump’s toughest trade action since April’s sweeping reciprocal duties on nearly all US trading partners.
items.content: US President Donald Trump on Thursday announced steep tariffs on pharmaceuticals, heavy trucks, home fixtures and furniture, escalating his global trade war. The measures, effective October 1, mark Trump’s toughest trade action since April’s sweeping reciprocal duties on nearly all US trading partners.

items.title: U.S. to impose tariffs on pharmaceutical drugs, furniture and heavy trucks
items.standfirst: President Trump announced a 100% tariff on pharmaceutical drugs, a 50% tariff on kitchen cabinets and bathroom vanities, a 30% tariff on upholstered furniture and a 25% tariff on heavy trucks.
items.content: President Trump announced a 100% tariff on pharmaceutical drugs, a 50% tariff on kitchen cabinets and bathroom vanities, a 30% tariff on upholstered furniture and a 25% tariff on heavy trucks.

ai_summary: President Trump announced tariffs on pharmaceuticals, trucks, and furniture.
A 100% tariff will be imposed on branded pharmaceutical products.
Tariffs of 25% on trucks and 30% on furniture will also be implemented.
The tariffs are scheduled to take effect on October 1.
Drugmakers' shares fell modestly after the announcement, but generic imports were spared.

The stakes are higher than ever for the Israeli leader, whose address comes on the heels of widespread recognition of an independent Palestinian state. Follow our liveblog for the latest updates.

clusters.title: French court sentences former president Sarkozy to five years in prison: What's next?
clusters.neutral_headline: French Court Sentences Former President Sarkozy to Five Years

items.title: French court sentences former president Sarkozy to five years in prison: What's next?
items.standfirst: A court on Thursday (September 25) sentenced former French president Nicolas Sarkozy to five years in prison over a scheme for late Libyan dictator Moamer Kadhafi to fund his 2007 presidential run.
items.content: A court on Thursday (September 25) sentenced former French president Nicolas Sarkozy to five years in prison over a scheme for late Libyan dictator Moamer Kadhafi to fund his 2007 presidential run.

items.title: 'Spectacular downfall': International press reacts to Sarkozy's jail sentence
items.standfirst: A court on Thursday (September 25) sentenced former French president Nicolas Sarkozy to five years in prison over a scheme for late Libyan dictator Muammar Gaddafi to fund his 2007 presidential run. FRANCE 24's Shirli Sitbon tells us more about how international papers reacted.
items.content: A court on Thursday (September 25) sentenced former French president Nicolas Sarkozy to five years in prison over a scheme for late Libyan dictator Muammar Gaddafi to fund his 2007 presidential run. FRANCE 24's Shirli Sitbon tells us more about how international papers reacted.

items.title: Sarkozy’s spectacular downfall marks turning point in France’s struggle against graft
items.standfirst: Experts say political legacy of former president convicted of criminal conspiracy now appears impossible to rebuildNicolas Sarkozy given five-year prison sentence after Libya trialWhen a Paris court handed Nicolas Sarkozy a five-year prison sentence on Thursday – for criminal conspiracy over a scheme to get election campaign funds from the regime of the late Libyan dictator Muammar Gaddafi – it was a historic moment for modern France.The rightwing Sarkozy, who served as president between 2007 and 2012, was known in office not just for his hard line on immigration and national identity but for championing harsher sentencing for delinquents. He is now expected to enter jail within a matter of months. Continue reading...
items.content: Experts say political legacy of former president convicted of criminal conspiracy now appears impossible to rebuildNicolas Sarkozy given five-year prison sentence after Libya trialWhen a Paris court handed Nicolas Sarkozy a five-year prison sentence on Thursday – for criminal conspiracy over a scheme to get election campaign funds from the regime of the late Libyan dictator Muammar Gaddafi – it was a historic moment for modern France.The rightwing Sarkozy, who served as president between 2007 and 2012, was known in office not just for his hard line on immigration and national identity but for championing harsher sentencing for delinquents. He is now expected to enter jail within a matter of months. Continue reading...

items.title: Sarkozy says he will ‘sleep in jail but with head held high’ after conviction
items.standfirst: Former French president receives five-year prison sentence for criminal conspiracy over pact with Gaddafi regimeThe former French president Nicolas Sarkozy said he would “sleep in jail but with my head held high” after receiving a five-year prison sentence for criminal conspiracy – the first time a former head of state has been sent to prison in modern French history.The verdict and sentencing followed a trial in which he and his aides were accused of making a corruption pact with the regime of the late Libyan dictator Muammar Gaddafi to receive funding for the 2007 French presidential election campaign. Continue reading...
items.content: Former French president receives five-year prison sentence for criminal conspiracy over pact with Gaddafi regimeThe former French president Nicolas Sarkozy said he would “sleep in jail but with my head held high” after receiving a five-year prison sentence for criminal conspiracy – the first time a former head of state has been sent to prison in modern French history.The verdict and sentencing followed a trial in which he and his aides were accused of making a corruption pact with the regime of the late Libyan dictator Muammar Gaddafi to receive funding for the 2007 French presidential election campaign. Continue reading...

items.title: Former French president Sarkozy given five-year sentence after Libya case
items.standfirst: Nicolas Sarkozy, president from 2007-12, was found guilty of criminal conspiracy but cleared of other charges.
items.content: Nicolas Sarkozy, president from 2007-12, was found guilty of criminal conspiracy but cleared of other charges.

items.title: Former French president Nicolas Sarkozy sentenced to five years in prison
items.standfirst: Former French president Nicolas Sarkozy has been sentenced to five years in prison.
items.content: Former French president Nicolas Sarkozy has been sentenced to five years in prison.

ai_summary: Nicolas Sarkozy was sentenced to five years in prison by a French court.
The sentence is related to a scheme involving funding from Muammar Gaddafi.
Sarkozy stated he would "sleep in jail but with head held high" after the conviction.
This marks the first time a former head of state has been sent to prison in modern France.
International press reacted to the "spectacular downfall" of Sarkozy.

items.content: Microsoft has blocked an Israeli military unit from accessing some services after preliminary evidence supported a media investigation that the software was used for surveillance of Palestinian civilian phone calls.

items.title: UK court drops 'unlawful' terrorism charge against Kneecap member
items.standfirst: A UK judge on Friday ruled that Liam O'Hanna, a member of the Irish rap group Kneecap who was charged with a terrorism offence in May, would no longer face proceedings because the six-month limit usually fixed for such charges had expired. O’Hanna was told he was “free to go” as supporters in court cheered.
items.content: A UK judge on Friday ruled that Liam O'Hanna, a member of the Irish rap group Kneecap who was charged with a terrorism offence in May, would no longer face proceedings because the six-month limit usually fixed for such charges had expired. O’Hanna was told he was “free to go” as supporters in court cheered.

clusters.title: Tony Blair being lined up to lead temporary Gaza administration - reports
clusters.neutral_headline: Reports: Tony Blair may lead Gaza administration

items.title: Tony Blair being lined up to lead temporary Gaza administration - reports
items.standfirst: Tony Blair is being lined up to lead a temporary administration in the Gaza Strip to oversee reconstruction after the war, according to reports.
items.content: Tony Blair is being lined up to lead a temporary administration in the Gaza Strip to oversee reconstruction after the war, according to reports.

items.title: Washington backing plan for Tony Blair to head transitional Gaza authority
items.standfirst: Reported proposal for international body to oversee Gaza for up to five years counters UN-backed plan for faster transition to Palestinian ruleThe White House is backing a plan that would see Tony Blair head a temporary administration of the Gaza Strip – initially without the direct involvement of the Palestinian Authority (PA), according to Israeli media reports.Under the proposal, Blair would lead a body called the Gaza International Transitional Authority (Gita) that would have a mandate to be Gaza’s “supreme political and legal authority” for as long as five years. Continue reading...
items.content: Reported proposal for international body to oversee Gaza for up to five years counters UN-backed plan for faster transition to Palestinian ruleThe White House is backing a plan that would see Tony Blair head a temporary administration of the Gaza Strip – initially without the direct involvement of the Palestinian Authority (PA), according to Israeli media reports.Under the proposal, Blair would lead a body called the Gaza International Transitional Authority (Gita) that would have a mandate to be Gaza’s “supreme political and legal authority” for as long as five years. Continue reading...

ai_summary: Reports indicate Tony Blair could lead a temporary Gaza administration.
This administration would oversee reconstruction efforts after the war.
The proposed body is called the Gaza International Transitional Authority.
It would have supreme political and legal authority for up to five years.
The White House is reportedly backing this plan for Gaza's future.
